private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk can be moved, never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Propose a correct, fully ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I control (A to H), interleavable with agent_2's moves, to achieve the global goal.

private_information: I can move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk can be moved, never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Propose a correct, fully ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I control (I to O), interleavable with agent_1's moves, to achieve the global goal.

private_information: I do temporal and causal auditing across both agents' move lists.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts and disallow quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-primitive meta-operations.
I ensure every move respects agent permissions, top-of-stack requirements, and size constraints.
auditor.goal: Merge, audit, and if needed correct the agents' proposed move lists into a single, globally ordered, rule-compliant sequence of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

private_information: I coordinate agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward.
I keep actions distinct per agent to reflect movement permissions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the audited move list and compile a consistent PDDL domain and problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi with agent-specific move operators and the specified initial and goal configurations.

init.move_format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) to O (largest).
Agent move permissions: agent_1 can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top to bottom D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg has top to bottom A, B, C.
Allowed moves must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, only the top disk may be moved, and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
Required output: an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that achieves the goal while respecting agent restrictions.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and an expert at Tower of Hanoi subplans for disks A to H; generate a correct, executable sequence of primitive moves for your disks only, respecting rules and ready to interleave with agent_2.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a fully ordered list of primitive moves only for disks A to H using the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'; do not include commentary, PDDL, or placeholders; ensure every move is legal and can be interleaved with agent_2.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and an expert at Tower of Hanoi subplans for disks I to O; generate a correct, executable sequence of primitive moves for your disks only, respecting rules and ready to interleave with agent_1.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a fully ordered list of primitive moves only for disks I to O using the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'; do not include commentary, PDDL, or placeholders; ensure every move is legal and can be interleaved with agent_1.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and ensure agent permission and size legality; you merge two partial move lists into a single globally ordered, executable sequence without violating any Tower of Hanoi constraints.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Inputs: moves from agent_1 {moves_agent_1} and moves from agent_2 {moves_agent_2}. Task: merge and, if needed, correct these into one globally ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'; ensure each step is legal, uses only top disks, respects agent permissions, and achieves the specified goal; return only the vetted ordered move list followed by a brief justification audit summary.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver. Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding the Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks and 3 pegs. Keep two distinct move operators to reflect agent-specific permissions (one for agent_1, one for agent_2). Use :requirements :typing :strips, typed objects for pegs and disks, predicates for on, on-peg, clear, and smaller, and facts to restrict which disks each agent may move. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
compile_pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Inputs: agent_1 moves {moves_agent_1}, agent_2 moves {moves_agent_2}, audited global plan {audit_report}. Compile a PDDL domain and problem for the 15-disk, 3-peg Tower of Hanoi that Fast Downward can solve. The domain must include two action schemas (move_by_agent_1 and move_by_agent_2) whose preconditions enforce that only the appropriate disks can be moved by each agent and that only top disks move onto clear pegs or clear larger disks, using a smaller relation. The problem must instantiate all pegs and disks, initialize the full initial configuration, the smaller ordering, agent movement permissions, and set the goal configuration exactly as specified. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Optionally include the audited ordered move list as comments to document the intended execution, but do not rely on it for correctness of the PDDL.
